you should definitely take a rest day imo!

also i agree completely w cardio being meditative but to ensure you dont convert entirely to exercise bulimia (over exercise fucked my hips up for the rest of my life) taking a break or limiting yourself for a month could be really helpful, and making sure you only go on walks if your in the mood too not bc you feel like you need to to compensate for food heart_emoji

the main thing that helped me w binging is accepting its okay to leave food on my plate when i go out/make a meal thats too big. for me if i over eat a little its like theres no reason to stop now since i alr fucked up, but actually letting myself stop when im full instead of worrying abt wasting it has helped a ton!

this!! even if you feel like art is more fulfilling rn you need to find smtn that will enable you to be mobile when youre older, bc rn youre (probably) young and dont need to do much to keep your muscles and joints working but eventually your body starts breaking things down if theyre not used. im not saying to start going to the gym for 5 hours a day, but learning something that will keep you active (walks/yoga/biking/even j a few squats when you stand up or like every game you play you do a push up or smtn will help give you more energy long term (bc your body will get used to doing a little more every day)
potentially you could but i wouldn‚Äôt recommend it, variety is v important for a balanced diet

my heart rate was so low i almost died in my sleep multiple times in the hospital, (weak heart caused by years of bulimia) and have passed out in dangerous situations multiple times, please stop before anything bad happens to you

i have been in the process of recovery (fully committed) since about june, ive only pxed 2x since then and the main things that have helped me are (as terrible as it sounds) trying to eat consistently, and for the first month(ish) not calling anything a binge because i needed it to rebuild everything ive fucked up in my body over months of ed.
also after eating doing yoga for digestion (knees to chest) and fill your time after a meal (start a new hobby/pick up an old one) and try to distract yourself for as long as possible after a meal.
im so proud of you for starting this journey towards a healthier happier life!!!
im so sorry this sounds terrible, but good job for not relapsing!!!! you got this

please give yourself some leeway, you said you went a few years w out purging and thats amazing!!! ik it may seem like now that youve had one behaviour you should j full send it but honestly your body will react much better if you continue w a few balanced meals a day, dont let one trip up fuck you over your stronger than that. my dms are open if you ever need to talk heart_emoji

ugh oml im sorry that your brothers so stupid, mine are the same way. but also egg in salad is my favorite thing ever!!!! you need protein in a salad for your body to use the food efficiently to actually lose weight heart_emoji try to ignore what he said and keep doing you bae!!!!

yes! where i went we had yoga daily after meals during the day to help w digestion, some help esp well like hugging knees to chest. im sure googling stretches for digestion could give more help too, good luck and your doing great!!!
my dms are always open, i was in the exact spot you were a few months ago but i was able to move past it, so if you ever need an understanding ear im here

i started recovery like 2 months ago and the thing that helped me the most was getting new clothes! personally i love everything oversized so once some clothes started to actually fit ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù i got sm anxiety abt feeling the fabric touch me and felt like i was being suffocated and my body was getting way too big, but once i got new clothes that were actually my size i felt sm better

WRITING.TEXT.Element:Text: i am in the exact same place, except ive gained 20 lbs..forced bedrest for 2+months as of rn. sending love ik how terrible it is but just know the feeling of gross rn will help you be able to have a healthy relationship w food, without feeling the need to ‚Äòmake up‚Äô for whatever you eat.
the only thing that was able to help me stop binging was to get in a normal routine, break the bp cycle bb!!!
i completely feel this...like if i never ‚Äúfelt‚Äù my body i dont think id have an ed

i know how hard choosing recovery is so im not trying to force this on you, i cant imagine how difficult your situation is, but im in early recovery rn and the only thing thats helped me stop binging in 8 years is a consistent meal plan, if its not one meal a day dont feel bad because thats what most people need anyway. sending love and support, and my dms are open if you ever need anything heart_emoji

for me in the past if i waited like 40+min after eating it would mostly be ‚Äúpastey‚Äù ... i think its just because it was digested further, also eating a water heavy fruit helps me w feeling fullness!! (watermelon/grapes)

sending sm love and support, i know this is terrible but youll be okay lover heart_emoji

omg wow!!!! thats huge!!! congrats and keep going strong heart_emoji

i went in to treatment and was diagnosed w~severe bulimia~ but now that im in treatment the main thing were talking abt is dealing w the gym culture idealized beauty standard of health instead of what actual health is:woman_shrugging:

trust me its completely normal!!! esp w binge/purge behaviours! they told me a weight range and im currently 20+ lbs above it, but my doctors are insanely happy because im stable. dont stress too much about a number if you are acting the way you should, (digesting food fully), your body will sort itself out. water weight can be retained or muscle (such as the heart) can be regrowing since purging can be so damaging and draining of electrolytes which are insanely important for muscle growth. please stick with recovery i promise it will be worth it!!! im here if you want to vent ever heart_emoji

personally im the same height, but almost 180 lbs and recovered, ive been able to lose most of the body dysmorphic obsessive vision and been able to accept that its just a number and i look stronger and better than i have before, especially when i was purging everything i ate

oml!!! getting to 12 days is insanely impressive!!! this is j a bump in the road, dont let black and white thinking further lead you to relapse, your still on an amazing win streak against your ed and ik you can keep it going!!

something that completely helped me when i started recovery was acknowledging that there cant be any ‚Äúbinges‚Äù because all the food your eating rn is helping your body grow stronger and beat back the ed, i know that sounds hard to accept but its not forever.
I love you and your doing amazing. please dont give up on recovery because you had a one second lapse, i know first hand how much recovery is worth it heart_emoji

so today has been a rollercoaster, started out waking up at 12 when i can normally drag myself out of bed by 9, so alr a bad start which led to me crying on my floor because my sister kept harrasing me
my dad saw me crying and decided to mock me and call me crazy, took my car and friend ‚Äúprivileges‚Äù away for a tbd time
i ended up calling my mom crying and told her ive wanted to kms for a while and my dad heard and decided to drug test me
he kept pressing me and calling me crazy so i decided to rip the bandage off and tell them ive been so unstable bc of the bulimia, neither of them were surprised and my mom was really supportive

sorry for the discombobulated rant but idk how to feel and dont have anyone else to tell. im glad i finally told them and im hoping they can actually help me but scary

this has potential for bad things but plan your meals ! dont get to anal abt it or it could shift to restrictive or trigger a binge but before i sit down to eat i plan out (in my head or journal) what sort of food im craving and what can satiate it and hits a few nutritional points... like if im craving bread instead of j eating a whole loaf ill have (fluffy) oatmeal w pb and fruit or pita and hummus and whatever veggies i have on hand, dont worry too much abt portions but try to be mindful while you eat
